data.title: Atari Age Magazine (Nov. 1983/Feb. 1984) - Volume 1, Number 2) OFFICIAL INTRODUCTION OF MARIO BROS by (Magazines) MORGENSTERN, Steve (Editor): Very Good Original wraps (1983) First Edition.
data.meta_description: First Edition. - Original wraps - The Atari Club, Philadelphia - 1983 - Condition: Very Good - 8 1/2 X 11 Inches. 34 Pages. Time Warp Ahead!!! Original complete issue of Atari Age magazine. All fold-outs and order forms intact. Slight wear to edges, but very clean overall. This issue of Atari Age features the double page coverage of Mario Bros. by Nintendo. The Atari 2600 and 5200 Mario cartridges pre-date the NES Classic home video system of 1985 (1987 in the US). Second to last issue of this magazine as it would turn out. Catalog intact! Every issue of Atari Age is like a little 1980's time capsule in my opinion. The graphics, the interviews and the format itself are so representative of what we think of when think 80's pop culture. ATARI AGE MAGAZINE WAS THE FIRST MAGAZINE IN HISTORY DEVOTED TO GAMING AND GAMING CULTURE! - Atari Age Magazine (Nov. 1983/Feb. 1984) - Volume 1, Number 2) OFFICIAL INTRODUCTION OF MARIO BROS
data.text:
About this Item

8 1/2 X 11 Inches. 34 Pages. Time Warp Ahead!!! Original complete issue of Atari Age magazine. All fold-outs and order forms intact. Slight wear to edges, but very clean overall. This issue of Atari Age features the double page coverage of Mario Bros. by Nintendo. The Atari 2600 and 5200 Mario cartridges pre-date the NES Classic home video system of 1985 (1987 in the US). Second to last issue of this magazine as it would turn out. Catalog intact! Every issue of Atari Age is like a little 1980's time capsule in my opinion. The graphics, the interviews and the format itself are so representative of what we think of when think 80's pop culture. ATARI AGE MAGAZINE WAS THE FIRST MAGAZINE IN HISTORY DEVOTED TO GAMING AND GAMING CULTURE!. Seller Inventory # 214

Contact seller

Report this item

Back in Time Rare Books is the home of Mike Cotter and his traveling band of misfit books! Mike has been in the rare books business in some form or fashion for nearly twenty years. The older he gets, the more his collection starts to resemble his bedroom at the age of 10. The stock at Back in Time is officially classified as General Antiquarian, but the truth of the matter is that the stock is a smattering of historical pieces that have found their way beyond the gates of Endor. You see, Mike has two great loves in his professional life - American History & Pop Culture of the late 20th Century. Back in Time is a member of the Florida Antiquarian Booksellers Association (FABA) as well as the Antiquarian Booksellers Association of America (ABAA). USPAP compliant appraisal work provided for those in need of insurance and/or IRS appraisals.

Visit Seller's Storefront

Association Member Members of these associations are committed to maintaining the highest standards. They vouch for the authenticity of all items offered for sale. They provide expert and detailed descriptions, disclose all significant defects and/or restorations, provide clear and accurate pricing, and operate with fairness and honesty during the purchase experience.

Shipping Terms:

Shipping costs are based on books weighing 2.2 LB, or 1 KG. If your book order is heavy or oversized, we may contact you to let you know extra shipping is required.
